    • Field Detail

      • MINSIZE

        public static final int MINSIZE
        Minimum value of the size of the table. Value reach when the table is empty.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • MAXSIZE

        public static final int MAXSIZE
        Maximum value of the size of the hand. Value reach when all the domino pieces has been placed on the table. Must be consistent to the total amount of domino pieces DominoInt.TOTAL .
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • INVARIANT

        public static final boolean INVARIANT
        The class invariant checks that MAXSIZE value is bigger than the MINSIZE and that the MAXSIZE and DominoInt.TOTAL are consistent.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static Table getInstance()
        Returns:
        the unique instance of Table.

      • addLeft

        public void addLeft(DominoInt domino)
             throws BadMatchException,
                    java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                    InvariantBrokenException
        Add a domino piece on the left end of the table. The right side of the domino must match the left end of the board.
        Parameters:
        domino - the domino piece to add.
        Throws:
        BadMatchException - if Domino does not match with table left side.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the domino is null or not valid.
        InvariantBrokenException - if the table state is not valid after execution.

      • addRight

        public void addRight(DominoInt domino)
              throws BadMatchException,
                     java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                     InvariantBrokenException
        Add a domino piece on the right end of the table. The left side of the domino must match the right end of the board.
        Parameters:
        domino - the domino piece to add.
        Throws:
        BadMatchException - if Domino does not match with table right side.
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the domino is null or not valid.
        InvariantBrokenException - if the table state is not valid after execution.

      • add

        public boolean add(DominoInt domino)
            throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException,
                   InvariantBrokenException
        Add a domino piece to the table. It is possible to add a piece to the table if it at least one of the sides of the domino piece corresponds to the end values of the table. This method is consistent with the method GGame.putDominoOnTable(InterfaceDomino d) . If the board is empty, the domino is added. If both sides of domino match the end values of the table. Priority is given to the left side of the domino.
        Parameters:
        domino - the domino piece to add.
        Returns:
        true if it was possible to add the piece. False otherwise.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the domino is null or not valid.
        InvariantBrokenException - if the table state is not valid after execution.

      • getEndValues

        public DominoInt getEndValues()
        Return the end values of the table in a Domino object. The left side of the Domino represents the left end of the table. The right side of the Domino represents the right end of the table. The left end of the table is the left side of the first domino on the table list. The right end of the table is the right side of the last domino on the table list.
        Returns:
        a domino piece with the end values of the table. Null if the table is empty.

      • getSize

        public int getSize()
        Returns:
        the size of the table.

      • isEmpty

        public boolean isEmpty()
        Indicate if the table is empty. A table is empty if the size is 0.
        Returns:
        true if the table is empty. False otherwise.

      • getPieces

        public java.util.LinkedList<DominoInt> getPieces()
        Returns:
        the list of domino pieces on the table.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        String representation of the table. It consists on the list of dominoes separated by ",".

      • invariant

        public boolean invariant()
        Check if the size of the table is between the limits MINSIZE .. MAXSIZE. Check if all the domino pieces on the table are valid.
        Returns:
        True if the stock is in a valid state. False otherwise.
